intro: Plagiobothrys collinus var. collinus, commonly known as the Sierra sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. This species is often found in the Sierra Nevada and other mountain ranges in California.
